DOC.brief_summary: Use tobacco high among Alaska Native pregnant woman . The investigator conduct three phase study . The first study nearly complete involved measure biomarkers tobacco exposure mother infant . The second phase research qualitative study translate biomarker finding intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Biomarker Feedback Motivate Tobacco Cessation Pregnant ALaska Native Women : Phase 2
DOC.detailed_description: Developing effective tobacco cessation intervention pregnancy American Indian Alaska Native people national priority contribute U.S. public health objective reduce tobacco-related cancer health disparity . The propose project build successful partnership Alaska Native community previous work Alaska Native pregnant woman . We propose develop test novel biomarker feedback intervention relate cotinine level urine pregnant woman woman infant 's likely exposure tobacco specific nitrosamine carcinogen 4- ( methylnitrosamino ) -1- ( 3-pyridyl ) -1-butanone ) ( NNK ) . This 5-year project conduct three phase . In Phase 1 utilized non-randomized , clinical observational trial examine biomarkers nicotine carcinogen exposure ( urine cotinine total NNAL [ metabolite NNK ] , respectively ) among maternal-infant pair assessment conduct pregnancy delivery . In Phase 2 , obtain qualitative feedback finding Phase 1 individual interview conduct woman use tobacco confidant ( partner/friend/relative ) identify develop biomarker feedback intervention message . Phase 3 consist formative evaluation biomarker feedback intervention pregnant woman use two-group randomized design ass intervention 's feasibility acceptability , biochemically confirm abstinence rate end pregnancy . All phase project guide Community Advisory Committee . Each phase important step advance understand potential biomarker feedback strategy help Alaska Native pregnant woman quit tobacco use . The potential reach intervention significant public health perspective 600 tobacco user deliver year Alaska Native Medical Center Anchorage propose project take place . Developing effective intervention tobacco cessation pregnancy important reduce adverse health consequence mother neonate future risk tobacco-caused cancer .
DOC.criteria: To eligible woman must : 1. Alaska Native 2. age 18 year age old 3. provide write informed consent 4. participate Phase 1 research currently pregnant ( < = 24 week gestation ) 5. use tobacco product least past 7 day ( cigarette cigarettes/ST ) To eligible confidant ( he/she ) must : 1. refer woman participant 2. age 18 year age old 3. provide write informed consent 1. provide write informed consent
